data.title: The Irving Berlin’s White Christmas Leads have been announced
data.meta_description: As many of you may have noticed, we’re pretty excited for Irving Berlin’s White Christmas to swing onto our stage next month. Each day as we get a little more of a taste of what to expect our excitement levels grow. Earlier this month we all stared in our own take on “White Christmas” and today we’re thrilled to announce the real stars of the show!
data.text:
By ksmith

Joey Sorge* (Bob Wallace) is making his Music Hall debut but is thrilled to spend the holidays with Ogunquit Playhouse family, where he recently starred as Jimmy in Nice Work If You Can Get It. Other Ogunquit productions include Don Lockwood in Singin’ In The Rain and Robert in The Drowsy Chaperone. Joey just finished playing Bernard in Boeing, Boeing at Gulfshore Playhouse in Naples, FL. Broadway Credits include: the original casts of Nice Work If You Can Get It, How To Succeed In Business…, and The Drowsy Chaperone; Thoroughly Modern Millie; and the 2001 revival of Follies. Off-Broadway: Dino in Sondheims’ Saturday Night (Second Stage), and Pete in Summer of ’42 (Variety Arts). National Tours include: Lord Evelyn Oakleigh in Anything Goes, the iconic Fonz in Happy Days – A New Musical, and Jimmy Smith in Thoroughly Modern Millie. He has been seen regionally in Victor, Victoria at TUTS, Animal Crackers at Williamstown, Grease at Papermill, Radio Girl at Goodspeed, and Marty at Huntington Theatre. His film credits include: New Year’s Eve, Valentine’s Day, Contradictions of The Heart, Providence, and Audrey. TV/Web: The Knick, Alphabet Boys, Person of Interest, Numb3rs, Commander in Chief, and the remake of Night Stalker. Check out JoeySorge.com, and follow on Twitter and Instagram @sojoey.

Kate Loprest* (Betty Haynes) is very pleased to be making her Ogunquit Playhouse debut with White Christmas! Broadway: First Date (Allison) OBC, Hairspray (Amber Von Tussle), Xanadu, Wonderland; Drowsy Chaperone. Tour: Wicked (Glinda/Nessarose u/s) Chicago, Little House on the Prairie (Nellie Oleson). Off-Broadway: Under My Skin (Victoria), Sistas (Heather). Other Recent: Bright Star (Lucy) Old Globe, Engagements (Allison) Barrington Stage, Aida (Amneris) Music Theatre Wichita, Showboat (Ellie) Washington National Opera. TV/Film: Boardwalk Empire (Corrine), Running Wilde, All My Children. KateLoprest.com. GO BLUE! #adoptdontshop

Jeffry Denman* (Phil Davis) played Phil Davis in the world premiere, cast recording, and original Broadway (Astaire nom) casts of Irving Berlin’s White Christmas and won an IRNE Award in 2007 for the Boston production. Broadway: The Producers, Cats, Dream, How To Succeed. Encores: Face the Music, Of Thee I Sing. Off Broadway: YANK! (Drama Desk, Lortel, Callaway noms), Passion, Children of a Lesser God, The Holiday Guys. TV/Film: Erotic Fire of the Unattainable, Law & Order, Nurse Jackie, PBS Great Performances. Regional: Kid Victory (Signature), Crazy for You, Spamalot (Ogunquit), Singin’ in the Rain (MUNY), Into the Woods (Baltimore Center Stage, Sacramento Music Circus). An accomplished Director and Choreographer as well, Jeffry choreographed the Ogunquit productions of The Music Man and West Side Story and directed/choreographed Damn Yankees. He is the author of the book, A Year with The Producers and the co-creator of the iPad app, CastPRO.

Vanessa Sonon* (Judy Haynes) is thrilled to make her Ogunquit Playhouse debut! Her Broadway credits include Anything Goes, Erma (u/s), Spamalot, Lady of the Lake (u/s), 42nd St, Peggy Sawyer (u/s). First National Tours include Anything Goes, Erma, Spamalot and 42nd St, Anytime Annie (u/s). One of her favorite regional roles played is Judy in White Christmas, where she’s been seen in productions at the Ahmanson Theater, Walnut St Theater, and the Fulton Theater. Other favorite regional roles include Polly Baker in Crazy for You, Val in A Chorus Line, Cassie (u/s), Dee Lee in Smokey Joe’s Cafe, Gertie Cummings in Oklahoma, and Ginger Rogers in Backwards in High Heels. Vanessa would like to thank her parents, her family, and to Chris for their constant love and support. Many thanks to Mamma Kelli and to the Ogunquit Playhouse, for the opportunity to join this new White Christmas family!

*Member of Actors Equity Association

We’ll be announcing several more cast members in the coming days keep an eye out on our blog and if you haven’t gotten your tickets yet check out our opening night performance. We’ve just opened up a bunch of great seats and have a few surprises up our sleeves for the evening.

Buy Tickets

Also, we’ve just released a taste of what to expect on our Facebook page. Check out our promotional video:
